Major_Arcs.title: The Ghost Town Demolition
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the mysterious setting of Ghost Town and the conflict arising from plans to demolish it for an airport. It centers around Nan's emotional connection to Ghost Town and the impending clash between development and preservation.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Encounter and Temporal Anomaly
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene establishes the setting of Ghost Town and Nan's initial reactions to its seemingly authentic old west atmosphere, hinting at a possible time discrepancy.

narrative_arcs.title: Woman's Internal Thoughts on Time Discrepancy

sub_scenes.title: Urgent Plea to Leave and Foreshadowing Danger
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a new conflict with a man urging a woman (Nan) to leave Ghost Town, hinting at repeated dangers and misfortunes associated with the place.

sub_scenes.title: Nostalgic Memory and Harsh Reality
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene deepens Nan's connection to Ghost Town through her memories, contrasting her romanticized past with the intrusion of modern reality.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarification of Ghost Town's Current State
Reaction to Airport Plan - Initial Shock and Disbelief

Major_Arcs.title: Personal Conflicts and Blizzard
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to personal relationship dynamics between Nan and Cal, set against the backdrop of Ghost Town's impending demolition and a sudden blizzard. It explores themes of romantic ideals versus practicalities, and the challenges posed by both personal and environmental conflicts.

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Notions vs. Practical Love
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene delves into the relationship between Nan and Cal, highlighting their differing views on romance and love, and setting up past and present tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Cal's Perspective on Dreams and Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Business and Paternal Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shifts to Nan's home and introduces conflicts with her father regarding business matters and her perceived insignificance in family affairs.

sub_scenes.title: Reassurance and Resolve
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Nan receiving comfort and relationship advice from her mother and maid, leading to her internal resolve to seek clarity in her relationship with Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Confirmation of Cal's Affection and Effort

sub_scenes.title: Confession, Departure, and Longing
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Nan and Cal's interaction, Nan's emotional confession, Cal's departure due to duty, and Nan's subsequent longing during his absence.

narrative_arcs.title: Expression of Deep Feelings and Cryptic Response
Passage of Time and Lingering Longing
Confession of Pursuit and Revealed Motivation
Confrontation and Confession about Changed Behavior

sub_scenes.title: Blizzard's Impact and Operation Hay Lift
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the severe blizzard, its effects on livestock, and the arrival of 'Operation Hay Lift' as a relief, resolving the immediate fodder crisis and bringing hope.

narrative_arcs.title: Indoor Discussion of Weather and Worry for Loved Ones
Cal's Determined Resolve and Acceptance of Responsibility
Recollection of Restlessness and Expression of Hopelessness
Arrival of the Plane and Fodder Drop
Relief, Gratitude, and Renewed Hope with 'Operation Hay Lift'

Major_Arcs.title: Town Justice and Newspaper Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new Western town setting, focusing on themes of justice, heroism, and conflict arising from a cowboy's actions and a newspaper article. It explores contrasting perspectives on violence and morality in the Old West.

sub_scenes.title: Cowboy Showdown and Public Opinion
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a dramatic cowboy showdown in a Western town and showcases varying public reactions to the cowboy's actions and character.

narrative_arcs.title: Defense and Critique of Cowboy's Manners

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Hero Worship and Gun Conflict
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on Jeff's admiration for a figure named Clyde Surrett, his fascination with guns, and the conflict with his sister Sally regarding his behavior.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Concern for Jeff's Hero Worship
Sally's Disappointment and Jeff's Clyde Surrett Defense
Jeff's Justification of Clyde Surrett and Dismissal of Chane Benson
Sally's Rejection of Jeff's Claims and Warning
Jeff's Threat and Sally's Fearful Response

sub_scenes.title: Intervention and Advice for Jeff
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene shows Sally's continued worry for Jeff, her plea to Clyde Surrett, and Pete's commitment to helping Jeff, including a flashback illustrating Pete's past gun advice to a young Jeff.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Plea to Clyde and His Reassurance
Pete's Commitment to Helping Jeff and Sally's Appreciation
Pete's Flashback and Gun Advice to Young Jeff
Introduction of Mr. Benson and His Humble Response

sub_scenes.title: Newspaper Article Conflict and Benson Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on the conflict arising from Clyde's newspaper article, the public outrage, Sally's warning to Mr. Benson, and the subsequent confrontation between Sally and Mr. Benson regarding his intentions.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Warning to Mr. Benson about Clyde's Anger
Mr. Benson's Dismissal of Danger and Confrontation with Sally
Mr. Benson's Justification for Staying in Town

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Newspaper Conflict and Benson's Departure
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts escalating tensions surrounding Clyde's article, including threats and public outcry, culminating in Benson's departure and a reflection on journalistic integrity.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Defense Regarding Clyde's Article
Background on Clyde's Defiant Actions and Consequences
Sally and Jeff's Discussion about Clyde and Benson's Conflict
Dinner Invitation and Evaluation of Chane's Skills
Sally's Urgency and Chane's Pursuit of Clyde
Anticipation and Fear at the Door

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Management and Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc transitions to a ranch setting, focusing on Betsy's challenges in managing the ranch, the arrival of Steve Daley, and their developing romantic relationship amidst ranch troubles and external threats.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Brawl and New Boss Introduction
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a ranch setting with a physical brawl and the arrival of Steve Daley as the new boss, setting up initial conflicts and character introductions.

narrative_arcs.title: Ranch Brawl and Rejection of Gunplay
Introducing Steve Daley and the New Boss
Confirmation of Betsy's Competence and Steve's Approval

sub_scenes.title: Establishing Dynamic and Ranch Troubles
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene focuses on establishing the dynamic between Steve and Betsy, revealing ranch troubles and setting up a mystery around sabotage and missing cattle.

narrative_arcs.title: Steve's Casual Acceptance and Betsy's Amusement
Hank's Skepticism and Betsy's Defense of Steve
Betsy's Accusation and Hank's Explanation of Ranch Troubles
Mutual Caution and Agreement to Investigate
Departure to Town and Buckboard Ride
Questioning Hank's Orders and Material for Dress

sub_scenes.title: Town Confrontation and Romantic Confession
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Betsy and Steve's arrival in town, a violent confrontation with Fred Bridges' men, and culminates in Steve's romantic confession to Betsy.

Major_Arcs.title: Land Disputes and Romantic Entanglements
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new set of characters and a conflict centered around land disputes and fencing. It intertwines escalating violence with romantic entanglements, leading to multiple romantic resolutions and confrontations.

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Land Dispute and Gun Threat
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces a land dispute over fencing and grazing land, escalating quickly to threats and the drawing of guns, setting a stage for potential violence.

narrative_arcs.title: Valley Route Warning and Impending Confrontation
Arrival at Devil's Pass and Confrontation

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Concerns and Ranch Troubles
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces new characters and shifts focus to romantic concerns and ranch management issues, including worries about a rival gang and land disputes.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Dave and Father's Disapproval
Reflection on Morning Routine and Curley's Presence
Concern about Curley and Bear Fenin's Trouble
Dispute Over Fencing and Grazing Land
Escalating Tension Over Fence and Water Access
Defensive Stance and Threat of Gunplay
Curley's Gun Draw and Impending Violence
Carrie and Dave Discussing Feelings and Fred
Arrival and Confrontation at Carlton's Office
Reflecting on Fred's Defeat and Carrie's Victory
Chance Encounter and Casual Conversation at the Store
Inquiries About Fred and Confession of Love
Initial Concern and Arrival of Visitors
Escalating Confrontation and Claim of Authority
Passage of Time and Acceptance of Reality
Re-emergence of Duty and Dirk's Fate
Moral Dilemma: Mercy Killing vs. Survival
Providing First Aid and Assessing Injury
Parting Ways and Concern for Criminal Escape
Plea to Return and Confession of Love
Rance's Self-Recrimination and Awareness of Burden
Concern for Riding and Inquiry about Dirk
Successful Escape to Mexico and Relief
Rance's Reassurance and Readiness for Action
